pageContext.claim: “When I was talking to President Obama, he essentially was ready to go to war with North Korea. He felt you had to almost go to war. ... Because if you go to war there, you're not talking about 100,000 lives, which is a lot. You're talking about 30, 40, 50 million lives.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump has said this many times, but Obama has never confirmed it. According to the Congressional Research Service, “an escalation of a military conflict on the peninsula could affect upwards of 25 million people on either side of the border.”
